pageContext.claim: “We convicted 1,200 gang members and nearly 500 human traffickers -- you know, like human trafficking.”
pageContext.analysis: The information on 500 human traffickers being convicted is apparently also from internal data that is not publicly available. We are a bit dubious of this figure because, as we have written before, the Justice Department has a tendency to play fast and loose with the definition of a “trafficker” when it comes to sex trafficking. DOJ says more than 90 percent of the cases involve sex trafficking, under the definition of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000, but there are some labor trafficking cases. As for gang members, the number of 1,200 is based on an oddly worded DOJ news release issued in August. Once again, it includes data from Obama's presidency.
